meanings.definition: Preceding in time or order; earlier or former
meanings.sent1: The preriot meeting was scheduled for noon.
meanings.sent2: The preriot chapters of the book set the stage for the main story.
meanings.sent3: The preriot alarm clock decided to ring an hour early for fun.
meanings.sent4: The preriot sunrise painted the sky in hues of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The preriot footsteps in the snow showed the path taken before.
meanings.sent6: Before the main event, the preriot decorations were put up around the venue.

meanings.definition: A person who holds a position of authority or power before someone else
meanings.sent1: She was the preriot in charge of the project before the new manager arrived.
meanings.sent2: The preriot of the company retired after many years of service.
meanings.sent3: The preriot of the classroom always had the best stories to tell.
meanings.sent4: He was like a preriot, guiding others with wisdom and experience.
meanings.sent5: The preriot's portrait hung proudly in the boardroom, a symbol of leadership.
meanings.sent6: Before the new leader took over, the preriot's decisions shaped the company's direction.

meanings.definition: To come before in time or order; precede
meanings.sent1: The dessert will preriot the main course at dinner.
meanings.sent2: His speech will preriot the award ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to preriot the dog in entering the room.
meanings.sent4: The early morning fog will preriot the sunrise.
meanings.sent5: The first snowflakes will preriot the winter season.
meanings.sent6: Before the guests arrive, the appetizers will preriot the main meal.
